body: Hi, thanks for reporting an issue. I'll look into this and get back to you soon.
Hi @tanafranko, I have identified the problem and fixed it in cca2ec83c60411fcc32b53bd6c6e444db684a9bf. Will deploy it soon.
Fixed in cca2ec83c60411fcc32b53bd6c6e444db684a9bf.
The fix is now live.
Thanks for supporting the skill. Have you tried something like "Ask tomato helper to start (silent) timer" or "Ask tomato helper for (silent) timer"? I just tried and it should work.

that did it!  thanks so much!

Subject: [EXTERNAL] Re: [carsonip/alexa-pomodoro] Can I start a timer and skip the instructions? (#4)


Thanks for supporting the skill. Have you tried something like "Ask tomato helper to start (silent) timer" or "Ask tomato helper for (silent) timer"? I just tried and it should work.

Is there any way to ask tomato helper to have a longer timer like 35 minutes?  ;)

It doesn't have that one since Pomodoro is 25 minutes long.

Hi, thanks for the suggestion. However, the skill is actually a music player looping over some ticktock sound or silent audio file. Therefore it is not possible to have the skill and spotify working at the same time currently.

Thanks for the comment. I have also received comments about people finding the tick tock useful. In terms of user experience, I suppose when there is no sound, people may think the skill is broken. I will keep the tick tock sound as default until there are more people who ask for a change of default. For those who want the change please +1 in this issue. I'll close this issue for now.
Sorry for replying late. I'll take a look into it soon.
It works for me when the timer is activated. What region are you in?

India, it didn't for you , it restarted the timer

On Wed 16 Jan, 2019, 8:00 PM Carson Ip, <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> It works for me when the timer is activated. What region are you in?
>

Thank you for the info. I'll look into it soon.
@arveyMon I have identified the issue. The fix is coming out soon. I'll let you know when it is fixed. Thanks!
@arveyMon The update is now live. Please check whether it is working.
I don't even know there's a new echo wall clock. My guess is that it will work since this works like a normal Alexa skill. Please let me know if it doesn't.
So I tested out your skill and the echo clock. The clocks LED's do NOT reflect the pomodoro timer in either of the two modes.

Oh no. My bad. Sorry for the misunderstanding.
This skill is not a "real" timer. The clock's LED will not have any respond. This skill works with all Echo devices with a speaker.

This skill was created when Alexa did not have timer related functionalities exposed to developers. I just realized it is now accessible to developers. I will look into this feature and hopefully that would fit your needs.
If anyone is willing to take up the translation work, why not? I can take out all the English words used to ease the translation process.
Cool! I'll extract the English phrases in the script out to a file for translation later today.

I've opened a new branch: `translation` for this PR. Please rebase your branch to work on it. Also please check `lambda/custom/language-strings.json` for the strings to be translated.

This is not tested yet, i.e. I have yet to upload and try this version with extracted strings, therefore it is not guaranteed to work at the moment. But let's finish the translation work first. Technical issues can be resolved quickly anyway.

If you are free, feel free to review my latest commit on the translation branch to make sure there are no careless mistakes. Thanks!
I was working the same, but I see that you have already finished it. I'm going to work on the `lambda/custom/language-strings.jso` file as you mention.
@carsonip done on https://github.com/carsonip/alexa-pomodoro/pull/11
Nice. I'll test the skill in simulator soon.
Got a bit busy at work, I'll do it ASAP.
Hi @paulomcnally, thanks for your work! I have submitted to Amazon for review. Hopefully it will be published in a few days.
